authors: Pr. Olivier Bonaventure, his assistants and students

short_desc.en: Introductory course to computer systems. Exercices in C about I/O, syscalls, multithreading, locking, ...
short_desc.fr: Introduction aux systèmes informatiques. Exercices en C sur les I/O, appels système, multithreading, locking, ...

description.en:
|Build Status|

This course contains the `INGInious <https://www.inginious.org>`__
tasks for `UCLouvain <https://www.uclouvain.be>`__'s course LSINF1252,
computing systems.

Each `INGInious <https://www.inginious.org>`__ task is structured as
follows:

-  a ``student`` directory that contains the C code for the exercise
-  a ``run`` file that is executed by
   `INGInious <https://www.inginious.org>`__ when a student provides an
   answer
-  a ``task.yaml`` file that provides the description of the exercise

The ``student`` directory contains several types of files:

-  a ``CTester`` directory that contains the code of the `Ctester
   library <https://github.com/UCL-INGI/CTester>`__ that is used to
   execute the student code and intercept library calls
-  a ``student_code.c.tpl`` file which is the template that the students
   have to fill in
-  one or more ``test.c`` files that contain the actual tests

You can find in `Report.md <https://github.com/UCL-INGI/LSINF1252/blob/master/Report.md>`__ a description on how to write
a bug report for an `INGInious <https://www.inginious.org>`__ task

.. |Build Status| image:: https://travis-ci.org/UCL-INGI/LSINF1252.svg?branch=master
   :target: https://travis-ci.org/UCL-INGI/LSINF1252
description.fr:
|Build Status|

Ce cours contient les exercices `INGInious <https://www.inginious.org>`__ 
pour le cours LSINF1252 systèmes informatiques de l'`UCLouvain <https://www.uclouvain.be>`__.

Chaque exercice `INGInious <https://www.inginious.org>`__ est structuré 
comme ceci:

-  un dossier ``student`` contenant le code C pour les exercices
-  un fichier ``run`` exécuté par
   `INGInious <https://www.inginious.org>`__ lorsque l'étudiant fourni une réponse
-  un fichier ``task.yaml`` fournissant la déscription de l'exercise

Le dossier ``student`` contient plusieurs types de fichiers:

-  un dossier ``CTester`` contenant le code de la `Librairie
   Ctester <https://github.com/UCL-INGI/CTester>`__ utilisé pourthat is used to
   exécuter le code des étudiants et intercepter les appels librairie
-  un fichier ``student_code.c.tpl`` correspondant au template que les étudiants
   doivent remplir
-  un ou plusieurs fichiers ``test.c`` contenant les vrais exercices

Vous pouvez trouver une déscription de comment écrire un rapport de bug pour un exercice
`INGInious <https://www.inginious.org>`__ dans le fichier `Report.md <https://github.com/UCL-INGI/LSINF1252/blob/master/Report.md>`__

.. |Build Status| image:: https://travis-ci.org/UCL-INGI/LSINF1252.svg?branch=master
   :target: https://travis-ci.org/UCL-INGI/LSINF1252

authors: Full list on repo. Course given at UCLouvain by Pr. Olivier Bonaventure and Pr. Charles Pecheur

short_desc.en: First course in CS for new university students. Based on Java.

description.en:
Ce répertoire contient un ensemble de tâche INGInious pouvant être
données à des étudiants pour un cours d'introductin à Java. Les tâches
sont testée via `JUnit 4 <http://junit.org/junit4/>`__ mais n'importe
quel *framework* de test peut convenir (tant que certaines conventions
sont respectée, voir
`wiki <https://github.com/UCL-INGI/CS1-Java/wiki>`__).

Les tâches viennent initialement des cours LSINF1101 et LFSAB1401 donné
à l'Université Catholique de Louvain. Le support de cours utilisé est le
livre `Introduction to programming using Java - David J.
Eck <http://math.hws.edu/javanotes/index.html>`__.

Documentation et contribuer
---------------------------

Pour savoir comment contribuer et comment les tâches ont été faîtes,
voir le `wiki <https://github.com/UCL-INGI/CS1-Java/wiki>`__.

Authors
-------

-  Alexandre Dubray
-  Brandon Naitali
-  Olivier Martin
-  Tanguy De Bels
-  Anthony Gégo
-  Olivier Goletti
-  François Michel
-  Clémentine Munyabarenzi
-  Ludovic Taffin
-  Olivier Bonaventure

short_desc.en: A short tutorial on how to create tasks in INGInious

description.en:
INGInious demonstration tasks
=============================

This repository hosts demonstration tasks for the INGInious platform.

short_desc.en: A demo for C++ tasks, with error highlighting

description.en:
INGInious C++ demonstration tasks
=================================

This repository hosts C++ demonstration tasks for the INGInious
platform.

Please note that these require one of the container images ``cpp-gcc5``,
``cpp-gcc6``, ``cpp-gcc7``, and ``cpp-gcc8`` from PR
https://github.com/UCL-INGI/INGInious-containers/pull/31 to be installed
on the system. All C++11 and C++14 features are supported by GCC 5 and
better. Most C++17 features require GCC 7 or better. Features from the
C++2a working draft are partily implemented in GCC 8, others require GCC
9 which is not yet available as container image.

The default setting in all demo tasks is GCC 8.
